sources.data_found: NCES/IPEDS 2023 Award Data for University of North Dakota: Computer Science (11.0701) Bachelor's degrees: 59; Master's degrees: 19; Doctorates: 3.

student_data.notes: Official enrollment headcounts by major are not listed on the UND public analytics pages. Counts are estimated from NCES/IPEDS 2023 degrees awarded data using steady-state program duration multipliers. Undergrad: 59 degrees * 5 years = 295. Master's: 19 degrees * 2 years = 38. PhD: 3 degrees * 6 years = 18.

gpu_resources.notes: Talon Cluster: 2 GPU nodes * 2 V100 GPUs per node = 4 total V100 GPUs. While a 2022 NSF award (#2215993) exists for a new cluster, specific hardware specifications (e.g., node counts/GPU models) are not yet publicly listed on the CRC website, so only the confirmed V100s are counted. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: UND has a centralized HPC resource (Talon). The publicly auditable specs only list V100 GPUs. Student counts estimated via federal IPEDS graduation data due to lack of granular public enrollment reports.
